item.title: 日本首相高市推出大规模财政措施
item.description: 日本首相高市真奈的内阁批准了自大流行病以来最大一轮的额外支出，在一揽子计划中部署了资金以解决选民的不满，这可能会让正在仔细检查国家财政状况的投资者感到不安。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s cabinet approved the largest round of extra spending since the pandemic, deploying funds to address the frustrations of voters in a package that may unsettle investors scrutinizing the nation’s finances.】

item.title: 外国人因菲律宾中央银行押注而买入两年来最多菲律宾股票
item.description: 由于预期菲律宾央行将在下月降息以促进经济增长，全球投资者抢购了两年多来最多的菲律宾股票。【原文：Global investors snapped up the most Philippine shares in more than two years on expectations the central bank will cut interest rates next month to bolster economic growth.】

item.title: 韩国企业债券情绪在利率冲击后有所改善
item.description: 在短期国债收益率飙升至一年新高导致信贷买家要求提高风险溢价之后，韩国本地企业债券市场正显示出投资者情绪好转的迹象。【原文：South Korea’s local corporate bond market is showing signs of improving investor sentiment after a spike in short-term government bond yields to a one-year high caused buyers of credit to demand higher risk premiums.】

item.title: 凯茜-伍德的 ARK 自八月以来首次买入英伟达股票
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的旗舰基金在周四买入了英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.）的股票，重申了其公司 ARK Investment Management 看涨该芯片公司的立场。【原文：Cathie Wood’s flagship fund bought Nvidia Corp. shares on Thursday following the company’s blowout earnings, reiterating her firm ARK Investment Management’s bullish stance on the chip bellwether.】

item.title: 美国军舰驶入委内瑞拉后，俄罗斯油轮在附近闲逛
item.description: 据彭博社油轮追踪报道，一艘被制裁的俄罗斯油轮在前往委内瑞拉的途中掉头，因为一艘美国军舰在该国海岸附近拦截了这艘油轮的航线。【原文：A sanctioned Russian oil tanker made a U-turn on the way to Venezuela after a US warship intersected its route near the country’s coast, according to Bloomberg tanker tracking, raising questions about whether Washington could step in to curtail Moscow’s energy aid to Caracas.】

item.title: 穆迪下调评级后日本电产股价下滑，信用利差扩大
item.description: 日本电产公司股价连续第七个交易日下跌，原因是穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）再次下调了该公司的评级，正在进行的会计调查进一步削弱了该公司的信用度。【原文：Nidec Corp. shares fell for a seventh consecutive trading day as an ongoing accounting probe further chipped away at the company’s creditworthiness with another downgrade by Moody’s Ratings.】

item.title: 越南咖啡区暴雨成灾，洪灾死亡人数攀升
item.description: 连日来的严重洪灾导致越南的死亡人数攀升至 43 人，因为暴雨淹没了中部高原的咖啡产区，一些旅游区的水位仍然很高。【原文：The death toll in Vietnam from days of severe flooding has climbed to 43 as heavy rain drenches coffee-producing regions in the central highlands and waters remain high in some tourism areas.】

item.title: 日本交易所将修订准则遏制日本国债期货恶搞行为
item.description: 在野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Japan Exchange Group Inc. is set to revise its guidelines on derivatives trading, following a series of bond futures manipulation scandals at Nomura Holdings Inc. and other major global banks.】

item.title: 印尼 520 亿美元基金将 5%的资产投向海外
item.description: 印度尼西亚最大的社会保障基金投资总监表示，该基金准备将其近 520 亿美元投资组合中的多达 5%投资于海外资产。【原文：Indonesia’s largest social security fund is poised to invest as much as 5% of its nearly $52 billion portfolio in overseas assets, according to its investment director.】

item.title: 据说前染料与amp; Durham 公司首席执行官的公司将出 111% 的溢价收购该公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由前 Dye & Durham Ltd. 高管 Matt Proud 控制的投资公司 Plantro Ltd. 提交了一份新的提案，希望以约 3.84 亿加元（约合 2.73 亿美元）的价格将这家法律软件公司私有化。【原文：Plantro Ltd., the investment firm controlled by former Dye & Durham Ltd. executive Matt Proud, has submitted a fresh proposal to take the legal software company private for about C$384 million ($273 million), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度银行股因外资兴趣上升而创下新高
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 希腊总理称希腊IPTO可能需要增加股本
item.description: 希腊总理基里亚科斯-米佐塔基斯（Kyriakos Mitsotakis）表示，希腊电网运营商IPTO "在某个时候 "可能需要增加股本。【原文：Greece’s power grid operator IPTO will “at some point” probably require a share capital increase, Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said.】

item.title: 中国巨型铁矿石贸易商将禁令扩大至必和必拓的另一种产品
item.description: 在与世界顶级矿商的定价谈判陷入僵局之际，中国国营铁矿石采购商通知中国主要钢铁生产商和贸易商停止从必和必拓集团采购另一种品位的铁矿石。【原文：China’s state-run iron ore buyer told the nation’s major steel producers and traders to stop purchasing another grade from BHP Group, as pricing talks with the world’s top miners drag on.】

item.title: 印度顶级经纪商创始人加入亿万金融精英行列
item.description: 对工程师兼企业家拉利特-凯什雷（Lalit Keshre）来说，Groww（印度的罗宾汉市场公司）的首次公开募股是近十年来努力奋斗的结晶。【原文：The initial public offering of Groww, India’s answer to Robinhood Markets Inc., was the culmination of almost a decade’s hustle for engineer and entrepreneur Lalit Keshre.】

item.title: 彭博社对私募股权投资支持的人寿保险公司的观察要点
item.description: 在短短十多年时间里，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.这也带来了新的风险。【原文：In just over a decade, Apollo Global Management Inc. has reinvented the once-mundane business of life insurance — reeling in cash and generating profits that have inspired competitors to pursue their own variations of the strategy. That’s creating new risks.】

item.title: 软银定价发行 460 亿日元债券，发行量再创新高
item.description: 软银公司周五发行了 460 亿日元（约合 2.92 亿美元）的债券，使其今年的发行额达到创纪录的 4000 亿日元左右。【原文：SoftBank Corp. priced ¥46 billion ($292 million) in bonds on Friday, bringing its already record issuance this year to around ¥400 billion.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑持有澳大利亚稀土矿股权
item.description: 欧盟贸易与经济安全专员马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）周五在墨尔本举行的新闻发布会上表示，欧盟正在权衡对澳大利亚矿业公司的直接投资，以确保包括稀土在内的重要矿产供应。【原文：The European Union is weighing direct investments in Australian mining firms to secure supplies of critical minerals including rare earths, the bloc’s Commissioner for Trade and Economic Security Maros Sefcovic said at a press conference in Melbourne on Friday.】

item.title: 总理称希腊经济反弹显示欧洲南部超越北部
item.description: 希腊总理基里亚科斯-米佐塔基斯（Kyriakos Mitsotakis）表示，他对希腊未来18个月的经济前景持乐观态度，并补充说，希腊经济的反弹反映了南欧经济表现优于传统经济强国的大趋势。【原文：Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said he’s optimistic about the country’s economic outlook over the next 18 months, adding that Greece’s rebound reflects a broader trend of southern Europe outperforming traditional economic powerhouses.】

item.title: 摩根大通私人银行青睐印度股票而非中国价值股
item.description: 摩根大通私人银行（JPMorgan Private Bank）表示，它倾向于从中国股票转向印度股票，认为这个南亚国家强劲的国内市场和政策支持抵消了其高估值。【原文：JPMorgan Private Bank said it favors rotating from Chinese equities into Indian stocks, arguing that the South Asian nation’s strong domestic market and policy support offset its high valuations.】

item.title: MBK 完成 55 亿美元亚洲基金，比目标低 20% 面临调查
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士称，MBK Partners Ltd. 完成了其规模缩小的亚洲收购基金的筹资工作，在因其持有的一家连锁超市丑闻而引发的动荡的一年中获得了 55 亿美元的资金。【原文：MBK Partners Ltd. completed fundraising for its downsized Asian buyout fund, securing $5.5 billion in a tumultuous year sparked by a scandal at one of its supermarket chain holdings, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 议员称日本应在美国帮助下应对中国威胁
item.description: 一位直言不讳的日本立法者表示，日本应利用与美国的同盟关系来应对中国的威胁，而不是独自寻求会导致长期损失的快速妥协，这位立法者已被禁止进入中国。【原文：Japan should leverage its alliance with the US to counter China’s threats rather than seeking quick compromises alone that will lead to long-term losses, according to an outspoken Japanese lawmaker whose entry into China has been banned.】

item.title: 鲨鱼宝宝 "创作者62%的亏损使股价跌破IPO价格
item.description: 病毒式儿童歌曲 "鲨鱼宝宝 "背后的公司在上市几天后，股价就跌破了首次公开募股的价格，这股热潮也随之消退。【原文：The frenzy for the company behind the viral children’s hit “Baby Shark” has all but fizzled after shares slid below their IPO price just days after debuting.】

item.title: GfK 信心调查的每个部分都对英国预算感到不安
item.description: 在工党政府下周发布预算案之前，一项受到密切关注的英国消费者信心指数在各项指标上都有所下降，预计工党政府将在预算案中提高税收。【原文：A closely-watched index of consumer confidence in the UK has fallen on every measure ahead of the Labour’s government’s budget next week, at which it is expected to raise taxes.】

item.title: 研究发现：英国脱欧对英国经济的打击是官方估计的两倍
item.description: 包括英格兰银行高级经济学家在内的一批专家发表的新论文称，英国脱欧对英国经济造成的损害几乎是官方预测的两倍。【原文：Brexit has caused almost twice as much damage to the UK economy than estimated by official forecasts, according to new paper from a group of experts including a senior Bank of England economist.】

item.title: 新加坡在经济放缓前将 2025 年国内生产总值展望上调至 4
item.description: 在第三季度经济增长好于预期之后，新加坡将今年的经济增长预期提高了一倍，达到4%左右，但由于美国关税对全球经济的冲击，新加坡认为明年的经济活动将放缓。【原文：Singapore roughly doubled its outlook for economic growth this year to around 4%, after a better than expected third-quarter, but sees activity slowing next year as US tariffs hit the global economy.】

item.title: 韩国早期贸易数据显示出口势头不减
item.description: 尽管美国对汽车征收的高额关税削弱了贸易势头，但受半导体需求持续增长的支撑，韩国 11 月份的早期出口继续增长。【原文：South Korea’s early exports continued to grow in November, supported by sustained demand for semiconductors even as steep US tariffs on autos weighed on trade momentum.】

item.title: 日本称若日元过度波动可选择外汇干预措施
item.description: 日本就日元的急剧波动向外汇市场发出了迄今为止最强烈的警告，日本财政大臣特别提到了干预是一种选择，她正试图抵制日元的持续下跌。【原文：Japan issued its strongest warning yet to foreign exchange markets over sharp movements in the yen, with the nation’s finance minister specifically mentioning intervention as an option as she tries to push back against continued falls in the currency.】

item.title: 美联储主席保尔森表示对 12 月利率决定持谨慎态度
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行行长安娜-保尔森（Anna Paulson）表示，她将以谨慎的态度对待下个月的利率制定会议，尽管她仍然更担心就业市场的疲软。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Anna Paulson said she’s approaching next month’s rate-setting meeting with caution, though she remains more concerned about weaknesses in the job market.】

item.title: 美国股市下跌后，韩国 Kospi 指数下跌超过 4
item.description: 由于对人工智能相关估值捉襟见肘的担忧加剧，科技股再度下挫，韩国股票基准在开盘时暴跌达 4.2%。【原文：South Korea’s stock benchmark tumbled as much as 4.2% at the open, as tech-heavy selloffs resumed on mounting concerns over stretched AI-related valuations.】

item.title: 美国就业数据令降息前景黯淡，黄金保持稳定
item.description: 美国就业报告喜忧参半，几乎没有为美联储降息提供新的动力，因此黄金持稳。【原文：Gold was steady after a mixed US jobs report that offered little fresh incentive for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.】
